title: Forrest Gump
brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as one of the most memorable characters in cinematic history, Forrest Gump, the big-hearted man who was there in the biggest moments in American history. Directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Eric Roth won six Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

description: By 1994, when Forrest Gump was released in the States, computer-generated imagery (CGI) had developed to a point where it facilitated almost seamless visual effects. CGI and greenscreen technology allowed Forrest Gump (Tom Hanks) not only to interact on-screen with historical figures including John F. Kennedy, John Lennon and Lyndon B. Johnson but also to memorably compete in a table tennis tournament in which the ping pong ball was digitally grafted onto the action. The uplift and homespun bonhomie of Gump’s character offered American audiences a story of an American war veteran they could champion and take to their hearts. The film was a box office hit and won six Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Director, Best Film Editing and Best Effects, Visual Effects.
